{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question asks for the most probable diagnosis of a child presenting with severe itching over the web of fingers, more at night, with examination revealing burrows. The symptoms suggest an allergic contact dermatitis or an infestation. The presence of burrows suggests an infestation, which is further supported by the fact that the itching is more prominent at night, suggesting an ectoparasite. Scabies is a common cause of pruritic papular rash in children and is characterized by intense pruritus, especially at night, with visible burrows.", "answer_choice": B}
